I simply loved it. Best value for money I found in Aveiro.

It's a forty minutes walk away (3km) from Aveiro, everything stinks and smell like humidity. If you want to feel like a chicken in a box, well that's the right place for you. No hot water anywhere and you have to take your hygeinic paper everywhere because there is none in the bathroom. Leaving this place and I'm relieved. The beds are comfortable i guess and the people are nice. At least, it was not expensive...

I give him two stars for the backyard and the good attitude of the employees of the place, but they are the worst three nights of my life in a hostel, the notice put a separate room, and as an independent it had nothing, apart from the fact that it looks like a cage for chickens, the walls are made of wood and only 1.80 meters high, and to complete they have rented a group of boys who do not know the word respect, at one in the morning talking on the phone, listening to videos, hitting things, breaking bags made of plastic, eating their soup and other foods with very strong smells in a space designed to sleep, and above all you ask them to please respect and care nothing what you say.  Definitely the worst thing that ever happened to me.
Fairly ok for overnight stay, in low price!!  The atmosphere inside feels very good to me!  I think you will like it too!
I really enjoyed. The place is quiet, clean and organized. A very good option to young groups.
Excellent

Simply fantastic! ü§©üêüü¶Ä
It‚Äôs worth visiting Aveiro just for this restaurant. We took a day trip from Porto and decided to eat here spontaneously. Even without a reservation, we got a table for an hour and a half. The stuffed sapateira and the grilled sea bass were simply incredible, and the rice that came with the fish was excellent too, full of mussels and shrimp, perfectly cooked and bursting with flavour.

The service was also extremely friendly, fun, and welcoming, which made the experience even more special. They showed us the fresh catch of the day and asked us our preferences. And to top it off, the price is unbeatable for the quality of the food and service. A truly great experience!

Great place with amazing sea food. I do advise to book for dinner in advance. Preferably go for dinner around 20:00. Service personnel were very accommodating, active in reservation (called us the moment the space freed up for us earlier than original reservation time).
The soup, stir-fried vegetables, and grilled fish were truly memorable. The stir-fried vegetables, in particular, were the best I had in Portugal. The staff were also very friendly and welcoming.
Came in hungry. Left with a happy belly. üòä got the last table and they are turning people away, so that's lucky.

Amazing meal! The mixed platter for 2 (110‚Ç¨) was plenty for my very hungry family of 4, next time we would also order 4 seafood soups (best in the world, dairy free). Freshly weighed before cooking, I wouldn‚Äôt mind heading there from Porto to sit at the bar in the back. Our total was 140‚Ç¨, including wine, a steak, 2 soups, moules. We could barely eat dinner, this meal was so good and plentiful.
I had Tripas de Chocolate Crocante and it was fantastic! Very fluffy and soft, not too sweet, just delicious. Would come back!
The attendant was very friendly. I really enjoyed the food.
They have combo for tripas, drink and coffee. Great food ambience.

This is literally the best tripa you will ever eat, it doesn‚Äôt compare to any other places you will eat. The Nutella one is a must and I eat every time I go to Aveiro haha. They also have salty options and the decoration is amazing to look while you are waiting or eating.
Very delicious tripa and the interior is very beautiful and unique.
Food is tasty but seems overpriced for the portions of meat. Service and ambience is good.

Amazing infusion of flavours and quite different from the flavours in Australia.  So nice to have access to Asian food after completing the Camino Frances and eating Spanish food. Well done owner of this
business!
Excellent restaurant for Asian! Pretty authentic taste and flavour. We really enjoyed our dinner here. Very good service too!
Excellent food & service. I've eaten here 3 times on my visit to Aveiro. Highly recommend

A ten-star restaurant!
The food was spectacular. We ordered the Veggie Gua Bao, Pad Thai, and Tahu Goreng Kacang. All the dishes were delicious, but the rice was on another level. We then chose two desserts, Chuoi Chung and Kue Lapis Legit, both very different, which made them even more special.
The decor is tastefully done.
The service was impeccable. Everyone was more friendly and professional than the last.
The bathroom was very clean, which speaks volumes about the restaurant itself.
Perfect, we'll be back!
Good coffee

Let me start by saying that we couldn't take off our jackets because it was so cold, they don't speak English (but I can understand that), we ate fish that probably would have been better if it had been raw, and it was mostly cold!!
Too bad, we were hoping to find a traditional place outside the chaos of the city center.

The waitress was super friendly! We arrived 40 minutes before closing time (without knowing it), and the waitress served us without losing her smile. The food was very good.
